oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Wirkungen des Ökologischen Landbaus auf Bodenerosion
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kainz, Max
Siebrecht, Norman
Reents, Dr. Hans Jürgen
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soil
Soil quality
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Soil erosion is often calculated by models. Those are up to now not reflecting the specific conditions of Organic Agriculture (OA). The aggregate-stabilizing effect of grass-clover ley, which is a crucial crop for OA, is considered much greater than implemented in the models. Other factors not included in models include, the effects of organic instead of mineral fertilizers, the non-use of pesticides and soil cover by specific crops and weeds. This paper gives a first overview about the modifying effects of organic farming on soil erosion.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Kainz, Max; Siebrecht, Norman and Reents, Dr. Hans Jürgen (2009) Wirkungen des Ökologischen Landbaus auf Bodenerosion. Paper at: 10. Wissenschaftstagung Ökologischer Landbau, Zürich, 11.-13. Februar 2009.
